posts._title: Alain Tanner – Une flamme dans mon coeur AKA A Flame in My Heart (1987)
posts.title: Une flamme dans mon coeur
posts.excerpt: Quote:A very unusual, quietly intense experience, the film’s beating heart is Myriam Mézières, who co-wrote the script and is in every scene. Never afraid to appear ridiculous, she gives her all to the role, whilst Tanner (with whom she had a relationship) coolly observes from a distance through the soft, hazy grain of 16mm. The …

posts.title: La vallée fantôme
posts.excerpt: Quote:An ageing writer Paul is determined to make a film but he cannot decide on the subject or location. Instead, he chooses to concentrate his efforts on finding the actress who will star in the film, believing that she will define the lead character and content of the film. He recruits a young man, Jean, …

posts._title: Lynne Margulies & Joe Orr – I’m from Hollywood [+commentary] (1989)
posts.title: I’m from Hollywood [+commentary]
posts.excerpt: Quote:Performance footage and interviews combine to offer a hilarious look at controversial comedian Andy Kauffman’s surreal journey into the world of professional wrestling. He had kept Americans in stitches as a featured player on the hit television sitcom Taxi, but Kaufman would single-handedly destroy his small-screen career when he went on television to taunt Memphis-based …

posts._title: Claude Sautet – César et Rosalie AKA César and Rosalie (1972)
posts.title: César et Rosalie
posts.excerpt: Quote:Claude Sautet’s romantic drama Cesar et Rosalie (Cesar and Rosalie) stars Romy Schneider as Rosalie, a beautiful young woman involved with successful businessman Cesar (Yves Montand). posts._title: Jacques Tourneur – I Walked with a Zombie (1943)
posts.title: I Walked with a Zombie
posts.excerpt: A young Canadian nurse (Betsy) comes to the West Indies to care for Jessica, the wife of a plantation manager (Paul Holland). posts._title: Kumar Shahani – Kasba AKA The Town [Custom color] (1991)
posts.title: Kasba
posts.excerpt: Wikipedia wrote:It is based on the short story “In the Ravine” by the Russian playwright Anton Chekhov. The movie is an important work in the Indian Parallel Cinema movement which started in the early 1970s. It is one of the last films to be part of the movement as it died out by the early …

posts._title: Leonel Vieira – Zona J AKA Block J (1998)
posts.title: Zona J
posts.excerpt: Quote:Tó is a black boy from Zona J, a tough neighborhood in Lisbon, and falls in love with a white girl, Carla. Tó dreams to live in Angola, where his parents were born, however the reality the two teens are in makes everything complicated.

posts._title: Peter Cartriers & Daniel Fridell – Sökarna AKA The Seekers [Uncensored] (1993)
posts.title: Sökarna
posts.excerpt: Jocke is a troubled young man with a nasty right swing and a penchant for violence. His friends Gurra and Ray are not much better. There is no better evening sport than to beat up a couple of nazi skinheads and score some chicks – even if it leads to a path of doom.

posts.title: The Odyssey
posts.excerpt: Utilizing an exceptional international all-star cast and excellent special effects, Hallmark entertainment and American Zoetrope productions created this fun-filled adaptation of Homer’s most-famous epic poem. It was originally broadcast as a four-hour miniseries on the NBC network. The story faithfully chronicles the many adventures of sailor Odysseus (Armand Assante), his colorful crew as they encounter …

posts._title: Yrjö Norta – SF-paraati AKA SF Parade (1940)
posts.title: SF-paraati
posts.excerpt: The first true Finnish movie musical, released in 1940 by Suomen Filmiteollisuus (“SF” for short, hence the title), though some would grant this honor to Suomi-Filmi’s Meidän poikamme merellä (“Our Boys at Sea”, 1933), a film showcasing the Finnish navy as well as the singing talents of composer Georg Malmstén.
